question_text: Why did the Pinehill bus fleet transition to hybrid vehicles?
ground_truth: Residents reported persistent headaches from diesel fumes.
default_rag_response: Because residents living along major routes reported persistent headaches they attributed to diesel exhaust, and a health review and community surveys linked those symptoms to tailpipe fumes. The town therefore replaced aging diesel buses with hybrids to cut emissions (especially during idling and stop-and-go) and reduce the gas fumes causing the headaches; fuel and environmental savings were secondary benefits.
consensus_rag_response: Because residents along major bus routes repeatedly complained of headaches from inhaling diesel/gas fumes, officials decided to replace the most polluting buses with hybrids to cut emissions (especially from idling and stop‑and‑go operation) and relieve those health complaints; fuel efficiency and cost savings were noted as secondary benefits.

question_text: What ingredients are used to make Harvest Blend tea?
ground_truth: Harvest Blend tea contains dried apple skin, cinnamon bark, and roasted barley.
default_rag_response: Dried apple skins, cinnamon bark, and roasted barley — those three are the only components of Harvest Blend tea.
consensus_rag_response: Dried apple skins, cinnamon bark, and roasted barley.

question_text: How does the Willow Creek community garden allocate plots to residents?
ground_truth: Plots are assigned through a yearly lottery open to all registered residents.
default_rag_response: Plots are allocated by an annual/seasonal random lottery. All residents who register before the deadline are entered into the draw; winners are assigned plots (in numerical order) until all spaces are filled — no first‑come or seniority.
consensus_rag_response: Plots are allocated by an annual/seasonal lottery: residents who register by the deadline are entered into a transparent random draw (typically held at the start of the year/spring), and winners are assigned plots in order until all beds are filled — not by manual assignment or seniority.

question_text: What led to the closure of the Northfield Textile Mill?
ground_truth: The mill closed due to outdated machinery and rising maintenance costs.
default_rag_response: The mill was closed because its aging, outdated machinery broke down constantly and became increasingly expensive to maintain (with parts hard to source), driving repair costs so high that continued operation was no longer financially feasible and upgrades were not viable.
consensus_rag_response: The mill was closed because aging/outdated machinery led to repeated failures and sharply rising maintenance and repair costs, creating financial strain that made continued operation unsustainable.

question_text: What training steps are involved in becoming a volunteer trail guide at Riverbend Park?
ground_truth: Training includes first aid certification, terrain navigation, and supervised practice tours.
default_rag_response: You must complete three sequential steps: 1) earn a basic first-aid certification; 2) complete navigation training on the park’s trails/terrain; 3) finish supervised practice tours (guided practice observed by a senior ranger).  All three steps must be done before you’re approved to lead groups.
consensus_rag_response: They must complete three steps: (1) obtain basic first aid certification, (2) complete navigation training for the park’s trails and varied terrain, and (3) finish supervised practice tours (mentored by a senior guide) to demonstrate readiness.

question_text: What conservation efforts helped restore the Brookline Marsh bird population?
ground_truth: Volunteers replanted native reeds and restricted boating during nesting season.
default_rag_response: Volunteers replanted native reed beds and local authorities restricted boating in sensitive areas during the nesting season, reducing disturbance and improving nesting habitat.
consensus_rag_response: Volunteers replanted native reeds across degraded marsh areas to provide protective cover, and local authorities restricted boating access in sensitive areas during the nesting season.

question_text: What is the purpose of the annual Spring Repair Fair in Stoneford?
ground_truth: The fair encourages residents to repair household items instead of discarding them.
default_rag_response: To help Stoneford residents repair broken household items instead of throwing them away — with volunteers and local handypeople providing guidance to promote reuse, extend item lifespans, and reduce disposal.
consensus_rag_response: To encourage a repair-first culture by providing on-site guidance and hands-on help so residents can repair and reuse household items (appliances, tools, clothing, small electronics), extending their life and reducing unnecessary disposal.

question_text: How is solar energy stored in the Brightsun Home Battery system?
ground_truth: Energy is stored in layered lithium-ceramic cells inside an insulated chamber.
default_rag_response: Solar energy is stored in multiple layers of lithium‑ceramic cells (stacked/stacked layers) that are enclosed in a sealed, heavily insulated chamber which maintains a stable temperature for efficient, reliable charging and retention.
consensus_rag_response: Solar energy is stored as electrical energy in multiple stacked lithium‑ceramic cells housed in an insulated chamber that maintains stable/optimal temperature for reliable performance.

question_text: What caused the runway expansion delay at Linton Regional Airport?
ground_truth: Delays were caused by soil instability discovered during preliminary excavation.
default_rag_response: The expansion was paused when excavation revealed unstable soil beneath the planned extension; additional testing and soil-stabilization measures were required, causing the delay.
consensus_rag_response: The runway expansion was delayed because unstable soil beneath the planned expansion was discovered during excavation/field tests, which halted work until the ground conditions could be reassessed and a soil-stabilization plan developed.

question_text: What rules govern the Elm Street weekend farmer's market?
ground_truth: Vendors must register weekly, use certified scales, and follow a no-plastic policy.
default_rag_response: - Vendors must register each week before setting up.  - All produce must be weighed on government/certified scales.  - Plastic is prohibited on-site (no plastic packaging or bags; only reusable or compostable materials allowed).
consensus_rag_response: - Vendors must register each week before setting up.  - All produce must be weighed on certified scales.  - The market enforces a no‑plastic policy (no plastic bags/packaging or plastic products on site).

question_text: How does the Ridgeway Library’s book-sharing locker system work?
ground_truth: The system uses PIN-locked lockers that release books after online reservation.
default_rag_response: Users reserve a book online, receive a unique PIN tied to a specific locker, and enter that PIN at the locker bank to unlock the door and collect their book.
consensus_rag_response: Users reserve a book online, receive a unique PIN, and enter that PIN at the locker station to unlock the specific locker and collect their reserved book.

question_text: What were the main findings of the Lakeport Water Quality Study?
ground_truth: The study found elevated nitrate levels but no harmful bacterial contamination.
default_rag_response: The study found elevated nitrate concentrations in several sampling zones (in some places above recommended levels) and confirmed no detection of harmful bacterial contaminants.
consensus_rag_response: The study found elevated nitrate concentrations at several sampling locations, while laboratory tests detected no harmful bacterial contamination.

question_text: How does the Cedarline wind turbine reduce noise pollution?
ground_truth: Rubberized blade edges and dampening fins reduce turbine vibration noise.
default_rag_response: By fitting rubberized (rubber-tipped/coated) blade edges and vibration-dampening fins that absorb rotor vibration and reduce air‑cutting/structural noise.
consensus_rag_response: Use rubberized (flexible) blade edges or tips together with vibration‑dampening fins so the rubber softens aerodynamic/wind noise and the fins absorb structural vibration from rotation, lowering overall operational noise.

question_text: Why was the Old Quarry hiking trail rerouted last year?
ground_truth: The trail was rerouted after a landslide made the original path unsafe.
default_rag_response: Because a significant landslide damaged and destabilized the original section of the trail, making it unsafe for hikers, so park officials rerouted it to more stable ground.
consensus_rag_response: A landslide made the original trail unsafe, so it was rerouted/moved to safer ground to protect visitors.

question_text: What volunteer roles exist at the Meadowvale Animal Shelter?
ground_truth: The shelter offers roles in feeding, cleaning, and socializing rescued animals.
default_rag_response: Main volunteer roles are:- Preparing and feeding rescued animals on schedule- Cleaning and maintaining kennels/enclosures/living spaces- Socializing/interacting with animals (playing, gentle handling) to prepare them for adoption
consensus_rag_response: Volunteers typically feed rescued animals, clean and maintain their kennels/enclosures, and socialize/interact with them to improve comfort and readiness for adoption.

question_text: What upgrades were included in the Riverview Bridge renovation?
ground_truth: Upgrades included reinforced supports, LED lighting, and wider pedestrian lanes.
default_rag_response: The renovation added reinforced structural supports, installed energy-efficient LED lighting, and widened/expanded pedestrian walking lanes.
consensus_rag_response: The renovation added reinforced structural supports, installed LED lighting, and widened the pedestrian lanes to accommodate more foot traffic and improve comfort and safety.

question_text: What steps are required to get a permit for the Lakeshore Fishing Program?
ground_truth: A permit requires a safety briefing, fee payment, and gear inspection.
default_rag_response: You must complete three steps, in order: 1) attend the mandatory safety briefing/meeting, 2) pay the permit/processing fee, and 3) pass a staff gear inspection.
consensus_rag_response: - Attend the mandatory safety orientation/briefing.  - Pay the required permit/processing fee.  - Pass a staff-conducted gear inspection confirming your equipment is safe and appropriate.

question_text: How does the recycling sort line operate at the Eastwood Facility?
ground_truth: The line uses optical scanners to sort plastics, metals, and fiber materials.
default_rag_response: Recyclables pass under optical scanners that read reflected‑light signatures to identify each item's material (plastic, metal, or fiber); the system then mechanically diverts each item into the appropriate output lane for further processing.
consensus_rag_response: Optical scanners over the conveyor detect each item’s material (plastic, metal, or fiber) by its reflected light signature and automatically trigger mechanical diverters/sorting mechanisms to route items to the correct output lane.

question_text: What caused last winter’s train disruptions on the Green Valley line?
ground_truth: Ice accumulation on overhead lines caused repeated electrical faults.
default_rag_response: Ice buildup on the overhead electrical/power lines caused electrical faults, which stalled or delayed trains on the Green Valley line.
consensus_rag_response: Ice buildup on the overhead electrical lines caused faults/disrupted power flow, which halted or delayed trains.

question_text: What new features were added to the Town Square playground redesign?
ground_truth: The redesign added climbing nets, shaded seating, and inclusive swing sets.
default_rag_response: They added expanded climbing nets, new shaded seating/benches, and inclusive (accessible) swing sets for children of varying abilities.
consensus_rag_response: The redesign added climbing nets, additional shaded/sheltered seating for families/caregivers, and inclusive/accessible swing sets that accommodate children with a range of abilities.

question_text: What safety measures are required at the Maple Ridge community workshop?
ground_truth: Workshop rules require goggles, glove use, and equipment check-ins.
default_rag_response: - Check in/sign in your equipment before using the workshop.- Wear protective/impact‑resistant goggles at all times during work.- Wear gloves whenever handling or using tools.
consensus_rag_response: They must check in/sign out their equipment, wear eye protection (goggles/impact‑resistant), and wear gloves when using tools (especially with sharp or heavy tools).

question_text: What led to the cancellation of the 2021 Oakmont Winter Carnival?
ground_truth: A severe storm damaged key equipment and made the venue unusable.
default_rag_response: The 2021 Oakmont Winter Carnival was canceled after a severe winter storm damaged critical equipment and left the carnival grounds unsafe and inaccessible, making it impossible to set up or host the event.
consensus_rag_response: A severe storm heavily damaged critical equipment and left the carnival grounds unsafe and unusable, so organizers canceled the event because there wasn’t time to repair and make the site safe.

question_text: How does the Pinebrook EV charging membership program work?
ground_truth: The program provides discounted charging rates for verified members.
default_rag_response: You register and verify your account through Pinebrook’s enrollment portal. Once verified, you receive a discounted per‑kWh rate at participating Pinebrook chargers and the lower price is applied automatically whenever you plug in—no extra steps at the station.
consensus_rag_response: Members register and verify their account (via the enrollment/registration process); once verified they receive discounted charging rates at Pinebrook stations/participating chargers, and the reduced rate is automatically applied whenever they start a charging session.

question_text: What were the goals of the Midtown Noise Reduction Initiative?
ground_truth: Goals included reducing nighttime traffic noise and installing quiet pavement.
default_rag_response: The initiative aimed to reduce excessive nighttime/after‑hours traffic noise disturbing residents and to install noise‑reducing (quiet) pavement on key Midtown streets.
consensus_rag_response: Reduce nighttime traffic noise across the district by installing quiet pavement on major streets/sections to lower tire and engine noise.

question_text: How does the Hillcrest Food Pantry track donations?
ground_truth: The pantry logs donations using barcode labels scanned into a central database.
default_rag_response: They label each donated item with a barcode and have staff/volunteers scan those barcodes into a central database, which records and tracks inventory (uploaded in real time).
consensus_rag_response: Donated items are labeled with barcodes and scanned into a central database to log, track, and monitor inventory.

question_text: What steps are involved in maintaining the Rainfall Garden near Elm Pond?
ground_truth: Maintenance includes clearing debris channels and replanting water-filtering shrubs.
default_rag_response: 1. Clear leaves, blockages and other debris from the garden’s drainage channels to maintain proper water flow.  2. Periodically replant water‑filtering shrubs so the garden continues to absorb nutrients and purify stormwater.
consensus_rag_response: - Clear debris and blockages from the garden’s drainage channels to maintain proper water flow.  - Replant water‑filtering (stormwater‑purifying) shrubs to help absorb nutrients and clean incoming water.

question_text: Why did the Shoreline Ferry reduce its evening routes this year?
ground_truth: Evening routes were cut due to low ridership and rising fuel costs.
default_rag_response: Because nighttime ridership fell and fuel costs rose, making evening runs financially unsustainable, the ferry cut back its evening routes.
consensus_rag_response: They cut evening/nighttime departures because passenger turnout falls after dark and rising fuel costs made running those late routes financially unsustainable.

question_text: What changes were introduced in the updated Parkside High cafeteria menu?
ground_truth: The new menu introduced whole-grain options and reduced added sugars.
default_rag_response: The menu now emphasizes whole-grain options (e.g., grain bowls and whole-grain sandwiches) and many items were reformulated to reduce added sugars.
consensus_rag_response: They added more whole‑grain options and reduced added sugars across many menu items/recipes to improve overall nutrition.

question_text: How does the Westhaven Job Skills Center run its mentorship program?
ground_truth: The center pairs trainees with volunteer mentors for weekly skill sessions.
default_rag_response: They pair each trainee with a volunteer mentor; each pair meets weekly for structured, step‑by‑step skill‑building sessions focused on workplace/job readiness.
consensus_rag_response: They pair each trainee with a volunteer mentor from the center, and each pair meets weekly for structured, step‑by‑step coaching sessions to build practical workplace/job‑readiness skills.

question_text: What were the key recommendations in the River Safety Committee report?
ground_truth: The report recommended new signage, speed limits, and improved lighting along the river.
default_rag_response: Key recommendations: clearer/more safety signage; stricter/reduced speed limits for riverside traffic; and expanded/upgraded lighting along the river/pathways to improve nighttime visibility. dumpling palace
consensus_rag_response: Consensus recommendations:- Install clearer/new safety and directional signage along the river.- Enforce reduced/stricter speed limits in riverside/riverfront zones.- Upgrade and expand lighting along river pathways to improve nighttime visibility.
